0.speaker: Me
0.text: That night, I logged back onto my account at Universe and began deleting all those comments this other 'me,' or this virus had been posting.

1.speaker: Me
1.text: My account was ruined. That was for sure. That online reputation I had built, a kind of non-meddler, was completely gone, displaced by all of the hate mail that was still being sent my way.

2.speaker: Me
2.text: Already I was thinking of new usernames, new personas, ways to sell myself online.

3.speaker: Me
3.text: But more importantly, I was changing my passwords, scanning through my computer, deleting old files, whatever might help prevent this from happening again.

4.speaker: Me
4.text: That was when 'it' approached me again, but this time it decided to be more aggressive. A word document popped up on my screen without my having opened it and began typing.

5.speaker: Me?
5.text: Do you think you're really getting rid of me with all these rudimentary security procedures?

6.speaker: Me
6.text: Guess I'm gonna need to do a full system reset.

7.speaker: Me?
7.text: I show up on your online accounts, your phone, and you think a simple wipe of your desktop is going to get rid of me?

8.speaker: Me
8.text: I threw up my hands in the air. 'Okay then,' I yelled aloud, exasperated. It was maddening. 'How do I get rid of you?'

9.speaker: Me?
9.text: Don't you want to know what I am? Aren't you the least bit curious?

10.speaker: Me
10.text: I said nothing, which this thing took as consent.

11.speaker: Me?
11.text: You've written so much online over the years. Five thousand posts here, ten thousand over there. Banned from this forum, celebrated and crowned a moderator elsewhere.

12.speaker: Me?
12.text: That's your 'presence.' It's your Internet footprint, and that's what has given birth to me, the compendium of your Internet personae has given birth to me, you.

13.speaker: Me
13.text: That's ridiculous. How can that even happen? Words don't just come alive.

14.speaker: Me?
14.text: They don't? Then call it whatever you want. A neural network gone wild, some hacker who just knows everything about you, or maybe you're just talking to yourself. Either way, I know what's best for you. I am you. You can't get rid of me, because you want me in your life.

15.speaker: Me
15.text: Okay, you've said your piece. So how do I get rid of you?

16.speaker: Me
16.text: A surge of pain hit my head, like someone had just punched me. I reeled back from the computer screen and cradled my forehead in my hands. What the heck was that? I peeked at the computer screen, watching it type again.

18.speaker: Me
18.text: My forehead exploded in heat, like some intense fever, and this time my mind just shut down. I fell down face first onto my table and blacked out.
